algorithms.imageProcessing

Class EdgeExtractorWithJunctions

  • java.lang.Object
    • algorithms.imageProcessing.AbstractEdgeExtractor
      • algorithms.imageProcessing.EdgeExtractorWithJunctions
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IEdgeExtractor

    public class EdgeExtractorWithJunctions
extends AbstractEdgeExtractor
    Edge extractor operates on an image that has already been reduced to single pixel width lines and extracts edges from it, attempting to make the longest edges it can - this specific edge extractor stores and uses junction information, so is not as fast as EdgeExtractor.java. Edge extraction Local Methods: (1) DFS walk through adjacent non-zero pixels to form a sequence of pixels called an edge. (2) find join points (3) join edges using join points (4) find junction points (5) using the junction points, splice together the edges to improve the edges. Currently, improve means to make the edges longer (which is good for an image expected to have one contour for example, and doesn't harm corner finding for non-contour goals). (7) remove edges shorter than a minimum length (this may of may not be currently enabled)
    Author:
    nichole
    See Also:
    AbstractEdgeExtractor

    • Constructor Detail

      • EdgeExtractorWithJunctions

        public EdgeExtractorWithJunctions(GreyscaleImage input)
        NOTE: input should have a black (empty) background and edges should have values > 125 counts. Edges should also have width of 1 and no larger.
        Parameters:
        input -

      • EdgeExtractorWithJunctions

        public EdgeExtractorWithJunctions(GreyscaleImage input,
                                  GreyscaleImage anEdgeGuideImage)
        NOTE: input should have a black (empty) background and edges should have values > 125 counts. Edges should also have width of 1 and no larger. The guide image is used to alter the extracted edges back towards the highest intensity pixels of the guide image. The guide image is expected to be the combined X and Y gradient image from earlier processing stages.
        Parameters:
        input -
        anEdgeGuideImage -

      • getJunctionMap

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer>> getJunctionMap()
        get a hashmap of the junctions within the edges, that is the regions where there are more than 2 adjacent pixels to a pixel.
        Returns:
        hashmap with key = image pixel indexes, values = set of adjacent pixels as pixel indexes.

      • getLocatorForJunctionAssociatedPoints

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,PairInt> getLocatorForJunctionAssociatedPoints()
        contains information needed to find any of the pixels that are part of a junction.
        Returns:
        hashmap with key = image pixel indexes, values = a PairInt with x holding the edge index and y holding the offset index of the point within the edge.

      • findEdgesIntermediateSteps

        public java.util.List<PairIntArray> findEdgesIntermediateSteps(java.util.List<PairIntArray> edges)
        find the edges and return as a list of points. The method uses a DFS search through all points in the image with values > 0 to link adjacent sequential points into edges. As a side effect, the method also populates member variables edgeJunctionMap and outputIndexLocatorForJunctionPoints.
        Specified by:
        findEdgesIntermediateSteps in class AbstractEdgeExtractor
        Returns:

      • findJoinPoints

        protected java.util.Map<PairInt,PairInt> findJoinPoints(java.util.List<PairIntArray> edges)
        Find the join points of edges which are adjacent to one another and to no other edges. This method is intended to follow the first creation of edges from the line thinned edge image to find the unambiguously connectable edges. (Note that the method findJunctions(...) is later used to find where there are more than 2 adjacent pixels to any pixel.) runtime complexity is O(N).
        Parameters:
        edges -
        Returns:
        hashmap with key = edge index and index within edge of pixel; value = the adjacent pixel's edge index and index within its edge

      • findJunctions

        protected void findJunctions(java.util.List<PairIntArray> edges)
        Iterate over each point looking for its neighbors and noting when there are more than 2, and store the found junctions as member variables. runtime complexity is O(N)
        Parameters:
        edges -

      • joinOnJoinPoints

        protected java.util.List<PairIntArray> joinOnJoinPoints(java.util.Map<PairInt,PairInt> joinPoints,
                                                        java.util.List<PairIntArray> edges)
        join edges using information in the member variable joinPoints and update the junction and joinPoint information after the changes. Note that the join points must be first or last positions in an edge in edges.
        Parameters:
        joinPoints - map with key = the PairInt with x being the edge index and y being the index of the first join point within the edge, value = the PairInt with x being the edge index and y being the index of the other join point within the edge
        edges -
        Returns:
